citation.article-title: Salinivibrio costicola subsp. alcaliphilus subsp. nov., a haloalkaliphilic aerobe from Campania Region (Italy)

p.s: Description of S. costicola subsp. alcaliphilus subsp. nov.
al.ca.li’phi.lus. M.L. neut. n. alcalum alkali from the Arabic al of the end; quali soda ash; Gr. adj. philos loving; M.L. masc. adj. alcaliphilus liking alcaline media.
Alkaliphilic, aerobic, halotolerant Gram-negative microorganism of Domain Bacteria.
Cells are motile curved-rods, occur singly, 3.2–3.5 μm in length and 0.5–0.6 μm wide.
Non-sporulating.
Colonies were round with entire edges opaque and cream-pink with a diameter of 2.0–2.3 mm.
It is mesophilic exhibiting optimum growth temperature of 30 °C, but it is able to grow between 10 and 40 °C.
It grows at pH 7.0–10.5 (optimal pH 9.0) and it tolerates up to 25% NaCl.
No growth occurs without NaCl in the medium.
It is able to grow on glucose, galactose, fructose, mannose, lactose, trehalose, maltose, sucrose, Na-acetate, glycerol when the medium is supplemented with thiamine.
It is catalase, oxidase, gelatinase, casein and tyrosine hydrolysis positive, negative for starch hydrolysis.
Nitrate reduction occurs.
Q8 is the predominant quinone, traces of menaquinone are present, and the predominant polar lipids are PEA, PG, DPG.
C16:1, C16:0, cisC18:1, C18:0 are the predominant fatty acids (97.5% of total fatty acids), transC18:1, C20:0, C20:1 are present in trace amounts.
Strain 18AGT accumulates glycine-betaine as major osmoprotectant (>95%), glutamate and ectoine are minor components.
The mol% G+C content of DNA is 49.3 mol%.
Strain 18AGT is phylogenetically related to S. costicola subsp. costicola on the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequence and the percent of DNA/DNA reassociation with S. costicola subsp. costicola is 72%.
The following antibiotics inhibits the growth of the strain 18AGT: lincomycin (15), fusidic acid (10), tetracycline (50), streptomycin (25), erythromycin (30), gentamicin (30).
Strain 18AGT was from saltish spring in Salt's Well site (Campania-Italy).
Type strain 18AGT has been deposited in ATCC, USA (ATCC BAA-952).
The EMBL accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence is AJ640132.
